Buttons Interface¶

class epyk.interfaces.components.CompButtons.Buttons(context)¶
button(text='', icon=None, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip=None, profile=None, options=None)¶

Standard button

Usage:

rptObj.ui.button("Test")

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_button.asp http://www.kodingmadesimple.com/2015/04/custom-twitter-bootstrap-buttons-icons-images.html

Parameters

  • text – Optional. The value to be displayed to the button

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • icon – Optional. A string with the value of the icon to display from font-awesome

  • htmlCode – Optional. An identifier for this component (on both Python and Javascript side)

  • tooltip – Optional. A string with the value of the tooltip

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

  • options – Optional. Specific Python options available for this component

Returns

The Button HTML object

check(flag=False, tooltip=None, width=None, 'px', height=20, 'px', label=None, icon=None, htmlCode=None, profile=None, options=None)¶

Wrapper to the check box button object

Usage:

rptObj.ui.buttons.check(label="Label")

rptObj.ui.buttons.check(True, label=”Label”) rptObj.ui.buttons.check(True, label=”Label”, icon=”fas fa-align-center”)

Parameters

  • flag – Optional. The value of the checkbox. Default False

  • tooltip – Optional. A string with the value of the tooltip

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • label – Optional. The component label content

  • icon – Optional. The icon to be used in the check component

  • htmlCode – Optional. An identifier for this component (on both Python and Javascript side)

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

  • options – Optional. Specific Python options available for this component

checkboxes(records=None, title=None, color=None, width=100, '%', height=None, 'px', align='left', htmlCode=None, globalFilter=None, tooltip='', dfColumn=None, icon='fas fa-check', options=None, profile=None)¶

important(text='', icon=None, width=None, '%', height=None, 'px', htmlCode=None, tooltip=None, profile=None, options=None)¶

Same as Standard button but used to attract user attention

Usage:

rptObj.ui.buttons.important("Important")

https://www.w3schools.com/tags/tag_button.asp http://www.kodingmadesimple.com/2015/04/custom-twitter-bootstrap-buttons-icons-images.html

Parameters

  • text – Optional. The value to be displayed to the button

  • width – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component width and its unit

  • height – Optional. A tuple with the integer for the component height and its unit

  • icon – Optional. A string with the value of the icon to display from font-awesome

  • htmlCode – Optional. An identifier for this component (on both Python and Javascript side)

  • tooltip – Optional. A string with the value of the tooltip

  • profile – Optional. A flag to set the component performance storage

  • options – Optional. Specific Python options available for this component

Returns

The Button HTML object
